IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE STUDENTS, FROM EARLY CHILDHOOD THROUGH MIDDLE SCHOOL, WITH AN ENRICHED AND SUPPORTIVE ACADEMIC, SOCIAL AND ETHICAL COMMUNITY THAT ADDRESSES INDIVIDUAL LEARNING STYLES, APTITUDES AND NEEDS WHILE PROMOTING PERSONAL SELF-WORTH AND ACCOUNTABILITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE STUDENTS, FROM EARLY CHILDHOOD THROUGH MIDDLE SCHOOL, WITH AN ENRICHED AND SUPPORTIVE ACADEMIC, SOCIAL AND ETHICAL COMMUNITY THAT ADDRESSES INDIVIDUAL LEARNING STYLES, APTITUDES AND NEEDS WHILE PROMOTING PERSONAL SELF-WORTH AND ACCOUNTABILITY. THE SCHOOL COMMUNITY LIVES THE RECTORY SCHOOL CREED: RESPONSIBILITY, RESPECT, HONESTY, AND COMPASSION.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE CO-EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND SUPPORT TO APPROXIMATELY 220 STUDENTS IN GRADES 5 THROUGH 9 IN AN INDEPENDENT BOARDING AND DAY SCHOOL SETTING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EARNINGS FROM THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE UTILIZED TO SATISFY DONOR RESTRICTIONS ON THE USE OF THE EARNINGS, IF ANY, AND TO SUPPORT THE SCHOOL'S OPERATIONS.
FINANCIAL AID -2,159,611. COST OF GOODS SOLD 44,739. CHANGE IN VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP 53,819. LOSS ON BOND REFUNDING -147,284. CAMPAIGN EXPENSES -4,645.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 44,739. CAMPAIGN EXPENSES -4,645.
STATEMENT OF NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS PUBLISHED IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL NEWSPAPERS AS WELL AS ON THE SCHOOL'S WEBSITE.
FINANCIAL AID IS GRANTED TO FAMILIES ON A NEED BASIS. APPLICATION FORMS MUST BE FILED WITH THE SCHOOL SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE OF PRINCETON, NEW JERSEY.

THE HEAD AND HEAD'S FAMILY MUST RESIDE IN THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S RESIDENCE IN ORDER FOR THE HEAD TO EFFECTIVELY PERFORM PRESCRIBED DUTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROVIDING STUDENTS AND TEACHERS OFF HOURS WITH ACCESS TO LOCKED BUILDINGS AND OTHER CAMPUS VENUES WHEN NECESSARY, PROVIDING CAMPUS OVERSIGHT DURING EVENINGS AND WEEKENDS AND VACATIONS, AND PROVIDING COVENIENT ADMINISTRATIVE PRESENCE AT SCHOOL EVENTS. THE HEAD'S OCCUPATION OF THIS RESIDENCE IS A CONDITION OF HIS EMPLOYMENT BY THE SCHOOL AND IS FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE SCHOOL. AS A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE SCHOOL, THE HEAD USES SAID HOUSE FOR MEETINGS OF DONORS, STUDENTS, TEACHERS, STAFF MEMBERS, ALUMNI, VISITING TEACHERS, SCHOLARS, TRUSTEES, AND SPEAKERS, AND FOR SUCH OTHER SCHOOL FUNCTIONS AND AFFAIRS AS SHALL BE APPROPRIATE FOR THE BEST INTEREST AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE SCHOOL.
THE LISTED EMPLOYEES RECEIVED DISCRETIONNARY BONUSES BASED ON CERTAIN PERFORMANCE MEASURES DETERMINED AND APPROVED BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: STATE OF CONNECTICUT HEALTH AND EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES AUTHORITY

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REFUNDING OF SERIES B BONDS AND FOR CONSTRUCTION COSTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE K, PART II, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SERIES C ISSUE IS COMPRISED OF A SERIES C-1, THE PROCEEDS FROM WHICH WERE USED TO REFUND THE SERIES B BONDS AND PAY CERTAIN ISSUANCE COSTS, AND SERIES C-2, THE PROCEEDS FROM WHICH WILL BE USED FOR CONSTRUCTION COSTS. THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TOTAL ISSUE PRICE OF $10,000,000 AND THE TOTAL PROCEEDS REPORTED ON LINE 3 REPRESENTS THE PORTION OF THE SERIES C-2 BOND PROCEEDS WHICH HAS NOT YET BEEN DRAWN DOWN UPON AS OF JUNE 30, 2022..

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: COMPENSATION FOR EMPLOYMENT AS DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR & TECHNOLOGY SUPPORT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AMOUNT REPORTED IN PART I COLUMN (B) REPRESENTS THE TOTAL NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE PRIOR TO BEING PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR ITS REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THE APPROPRIATE OFFICER OF THE SCHOOL IS INFORMED OF THE APPROVAL AND THE FORM IS FILED ELECTRONICALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE IDENTIFICATION AND SUCCESSFUL RESOLUTION OF CONFLICTS AND POTENTIAL CONFLICTS DEPENDS ON COMPLETE AND TIMELY DISCLOSURE. DISCLOSURE WILL OCCUR THROUGH AN ANNUAL WRITTEN STATEMENT AND THE NOTIFICATION TO THE BOARD CHAIR OF OTHER ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS, AS THEY ARISE. ALL FINANCIAL AND MATERIAL FACTS RELATING TO POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTERESTS SHALL BE DISCLOSED. ANNUALLY, EACH BOARD AND COMMITTEE MEMBER SHALL SIGN AND FILE A DISCLOSURE STATEMENT THAT SHALL BE KEPT WITH THE RECORDS OF THE BOARD. PRIOR TO APPOINTMENT, ALL FUTURE BOARD AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS SHALL DO LIKEWISE. SIGNING OF A DISCLOSURE STATEMENT ACKNOWLEDGES THAT A PERSON HAS RECEIVED, READ AND UNDERSTANDS, AND COMPLIES WITH THE POLICY AS IT RELATES TO MEMBERSHIP ON AND ACTIONS OF THE BOARD AND COMMITTEES. DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS SHALL BE REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WHICH SHALL RECOMMEND ACTION BY THE BOARD, IF NECESSARY. WHENEVER A POTENTIAL CONFLICT ARISES THAT HAS NOT BEEN IDENTIFIED ON A DISCLOSURE FORM, IT SHALL BE DISCLOSED TO THE CHAIR OF TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IN A TIMELY FASHION, AND MADE A PART OF THE RECORD OF THE BOARD. WHENEVER NECESSARY, THE BOARD SHALL TAKE APPROPRIATE ACTION WITH RESPECT TO PERSONS WHO ARE IN VIOLATION OF THIS POLICY. IF THE BOARD HAS REASONABLE CAUSE TO BELIEVE THAT A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OR A COMMITTEE HAS FAILED TO DISCLOSE ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS, EITHER IN WRITING OR, AT A LATER DATE, TO THE CHAIR, IT SHALL INFORM THE PERSON OF ITS BELIEF AND AFFORD THE PERSON AN OPPORTUNITY TO PROVIDE AN EXPLANATION. IF, AFTER HEARING THE EXPLANATION OF THE PERSON AND MAKING FURTHER INVESTIGATION DEEMED NECESSARY UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES, IT IS DECIDED THAT THE PERSON FAILED TO DISCLOSE IN A PROPER FASHION THE ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT, THE BOARD SHALL TAKE APPROPRIATE CORRECTIVE OR DISCIPLINARY ACTION. THE BOARD, THROUGH ITS EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, SHALL UNDERTAKE PERIODIC REVIEWS TO DETERMINE COMPLIANCE WITH THIS POLICY. IT SHALL REPORT ITS FINDINGS TO THE FULL BOARD AND INCLUDE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR REVISION, WHERE NECESSARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE SALARY AND BENEFITS OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IN COMPARISON TO THE SALARIES OF THE HEADS OF SCHOOLS OF SIMILAR SIZE. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S CONTRACT IS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD FOR OVERALL APPROVAL. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEW THE SALARY OF THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER IN COMPARISON TO THE SALARIES OF INDIVIDUALS IN SIMILAR POSITIONS AT PEER SCHOOLS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
LOSS ON BOND REFINANCING -147,284. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SWAP AGREEMENT 53,819.
THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT CHANGE ITS OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR.
